intro: Silene inclusa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Silene inclusa produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, facilitating its propagation in suitable habitats.
